gr.forth.ics.swkm.model2
Class ModelBuilder

java.lang.Object
  gr.forth.ics.swkm.model2.ModelBuilder

public class ModelBuilder
extends Object

A builder of a model instance offering various configuration options.

Use the static factories to get a ModelBuilder, then optionally configure other attributes (they have reasonable defaults) and call #build() to obtain a reference to a new Model instance.

All available options are the following: 
 ModelBuilder.
      [newSparse(). | newFull(). | newTrees().]
      [withTypeInference(). | withoutTypeInference().]?   //Default value: with
      [withUriValidation(). | withoutUriValidation().]?   //Default value: with
      [withDefaultNamedGraphUri("someUri").]?             //Default value: RdfSuite.DEFAULT_GRAPH_URI
      build();

Except for the above three index implementations there is also another one called Horizontal. This one does not allow typing inference. All other options are available for this implementation, too.

This is a very simple example of creating a default sparse model: <pre> Model model = ModelBuilder.newSparse().build(); </pre>

Author:
Andreou Dimitris, email: jim.andreou (at) gmail (dot) com, Vouzoukidou Nelly, email: vuzukid (at) csd (dot) uoc (dot) gr

newSparse

public static ModelBuilder.TypeInferenceSettings newSparse()
Creates a builder that will build a Model efficient for sparse RDF graphs (i.e., the vast majority of RDF graphs).

Returns:
a builder that will build a Model efficient for sparse RDF graphs (i.e., the vast majority of RDF graphs)

newFull

public static ModelBuilder.TypeInferenceSettings newFull()
Creates a builder that will build a Model with full storing of triples.

It has high memory requirements, but is very efficient in answering triple queries.

Returns:
a builder that will build a Model with full storing of triples

newTrees

public static ModelBuilder.TypeInferenceSettings newTrees()
Creates a builder that will build a new Model.

Returns:
a builder that will build a new Model

newHorizontal

public static ModelBuilder.DefaultUriSettings newHorizontal()
Creates a builder that will build a Model with minimal memory footprint but very slow in triple queries.

Use this type of storage only in case when a bag of triples only needs to be stored. (For instance when a transorfmation from one type of rdf document to another is needed).

Since type inference of nodes depends on triples queries, use of this feature would require too much time and thus, is not allowed.

Returns:
a builder that will build a Model with minimal memory footprint but very slow in triple queries
